result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott R Bayer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid in 120 days or penalty of 9 days jail, consecutive for non-payment.

STRAIGHT TIME. Commencing forthwith. Sentence credit of 62 days were granted.
Concurrent with: Case 15CF0160

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Scott R Bayer in court, in custody, with Attorney Nicole M Masnica.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Masnica makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:   IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

120 DAYS STRAIGHT TIME  (CREDIT - 62 days)    **CONCURRENT WITH CASE #15CF160


COSTS:  $253.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid in 120 days, alternate 9 days jail)
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 9, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Scott R Bayer in court, in custody, with Attorney Nicole M Masnica.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Masnica requests a plea and sentence date.    Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Scott R Bayer in court with attorney Nicole M Masnica.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.
